intro: Tococa caudata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it has been introduced to other parts of the world.
